[Reef-pull-request-windows #94](https://builds.apache.org/job/Reef-pull-request-windows/94/) UNSTABLE

[Reef-pull-request-windows #97](https://builds.apache.org/job/Reef-pull-request-windows/97/) UNSTABLE
Looks like there's a problem with this pull request

Just want to comment that on a Windows machine without visual c++ runtime, we may get into trouble. Most of the time we don't see this problem even without the dll since HDInsight cluster comes with VMs that have visual studio installed, which includes the runtime.

Again, I can understand the need to remove the dll, just want to make sure the implication is understood.
@yingdachen Beysim suggested that new versions of Windows have the DLL out of the box. hence, we only support current Windows from hereon out. @beysims Can you comment?

I suspect recent windows versions ship with this dll. We do not have permission to redistribute it. If the dll is not already on the deployed machine, users would have to download the Redistributable  from http://www.microsoft.com/en-us/download/details.aspx?id=30679#
...and the user just needs to put the dll under global folder. It would be loaded by our program.
OK. I will merge it, then.

if the new Windows come with in out of box then that is fine since we can claim we only support Windows version XXX and after. If we have to ask a user to download something separately and put it in job folder, that would be a bit unfortunately. 

Agreed that we don't have permission to redistribute, but IF we cannot be sure about new version of Windows comes with the dll, should we look at the nuget solution discussed last time to see if that is viable?

Just did a test with a clean windows 2012 server installation and it does not seem to ship with VC++ CRT runtime by default.  I agree that requiring users to install the CRT runtime or copying the runtime dll to job folder is not ideal, but there does not seem to be a good solution right now.

As we discussed offline, @motus will work on moving this code into the `group` package instead of `nggroup`. The old group communications library will be deprecated and removed later. I filled [[REEF-158]](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/REEF-158) to track that removal/

that is good to know. i think it should cover 99% of most practical cases where REEF is being run moving forward. i was just a bit nervous because I hit the problem once with ASA integration. with newer cluster we should be fine :)

@taegeonum This now doesn't seem to be mergable anymore. Can you please rebase it to current master? 

@bgchun This is blocked on your input. Please have a look.

@taegeonum Can you rebase?
@markusweimer Sorry for the delay. I will take a look right after Taegeon updates the code.
@bgchun I've rebased it

[Reef-pull-request-windows #98](https://builds.apache.org/job/Reef-pull-request-windows/98/) UNSTABLE
Looks like there's a problem with this pull request

@markusweimer 
This's not the part where we assign a port. Port assignment is done in the Transport constructor. 

Before this change, `open` returns null if it fails to connect to a remote party after `numberOfTries`
With this change, `open` throws a ConnectException in that case.
This seems to be a sensible thing to do.

@bgchun I am done with the first pass - please feel free to review the code. The only major thing pending is merging `org.apache.reef.io.network.group` and `nggroup` packages - I'll work on that next week with with @shravanmn

this PR (with other) is currently blocking 7 builders on ASF Jenkins: https://builds.apache.org/
I don't if the problem is with the PR, or the current project state, or ASF Jenkins, but please review and abort stalled builds since it is causing starvation for other Apache projects :)

Looks like there's a problem with this pull request

This PR caused build failed. 

At root level, build with command line:

mvn clean install -PDotNet -PBridge -DskipTests

It causes \lang\cpp\reef-bridge-clr\src\main\Cpp\CppBridge\JavaClrBridge\JavaClrBridge.sln build failed
@jwang98052 Please file this as a JIRA such that we can track it.
I will test this.

Please do not merge this yet. I want to see what the Windows JIRA instance has to say.
